text: Then the high priest stood up before them and asked Jesus, “Have you no answer? What is this that they are testifying against you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he was silent and did not answer. Again the high priest questioned him, “Are you the Christ, the Son of the Blessed One?”
speaker: Narrator

text: “I am,” said Jesus, “and you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of the Power and coming with the clouds of heaven.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the high priest tore his clothes and said, “Why do we still need witnesses?
speaker: Narrator

text: You have heard the blasphemy! What is your verdict?” They all condemned him as deserving death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then some began to spit on him, and to blindfold him, and to strike him with their fists, saying, “Prophesy!” The guards also took him and beat him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now while Peter was below in the courtyard, one of the high priest’s slave girls came by.
speaker: Narrator

text: When she saw Peter warming himself, she looked directly at him and said, “You also were with that Nazarene, Jesus.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he denied it: “I don’t even understand what you’re talking about!” Then he went out to the gateway, and a rooster crowed.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the slave girl saw him, she began again to say to the bystanders, “This man is one of them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he denied it again. A short time later the bystanders again said to Peter, “You must be one of them, because you are also a Galilean.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he began to curse, and he swore with an oath, “I do not know this man you are talking about!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately a rooster crowed a second time. Then Peter remembered what Jesus had said to him: “Before a rooster crows twice, you will deny me three times.” And he broke down and wept.
speaker: Narrator

text: Early in the morning, after forming a plan, the chief priests with the elders and the experts in the law and the whole Sanhedrin tied Jesus up, led him away, and handed him over to Pilate.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Pilate asked him, “Are you the king of the Jews?” He replied, “You say so.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the chief priests began to accuse him repeatedly.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Pilate asked him again, “Have you nothing to say? See how many charges they are bringing against you!”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus made no further reply, so that Pilate was amazed.
speaker: Narrator

text: During the feast it was customary to release one prisoner to the people, whomever they requested.
speaker: Narrator

text: A man named Barabbas was imprisoned with rebels who had committed murder during an insurrection.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the crowd came up and began to ask Pilate to release a prisoner for them, as was his custom.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Pilate asked them, “Do you want me to release the king of the Jews for you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: (For he knew that the chief priests had handed him over because of envy.)
speaker: Narrator

text: But the chief priests stirred up the crowd to have him release Barabbas instead.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Pilate spoke to them again, “Then what do you want me to do with the one you call king of the Jews?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They shouted back, “Crucify him!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate asked them, “Why? What has he done wrong?” But they shouted more insistently, “Crucify him!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Because he wanted to satisfy the crowd, Pilate released Barabbas for them. Then, after he had Jesus flogged, he handed him over to be crucified.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the soldiers led him into the palace (that is, the governor’s residence) and called together the whole cohort.
speaker: Narrator

text: They put a purple cloak on him and after braiding a crown of thorns, they put it on him.
speaker: Narrator

text: They began to salute him: “Hail, king of the Jews!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Again and again they struck him on the head with a staff and spit on him. Then they knelt down and paid homage to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had finished mocking him, they stripped him of the purple cloak and put his own clothes back on him. Then they led him away to crucify him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The soldiers forced a passerby to carry his cross, Simon of Cyrene, who was coming in from the country (he was the father of Alexander and Rufus).
speaker: Narrator

text: They brought Jesus to a place called Golgotha (which is translated, “Place of the Skull”).
speaker: Narrator

text: They offered him wine mixed with myrrh, but he did not take it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they crucified him and divided his clothes, throwing dice for them, to decide what each would take.
speaker: Narrator

text: It was nine o’clock in the morning when they crucified him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The inscription of the charge against him read, “The king of the Jews.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they crucified two outlaws with him, one on his right and one on his left.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who passed by defamed him, shaking their heads and saying, “Aha! You who can destroy the temple and rebuild it in three days,
speaker: Narrator

text: save yourself and come down from the cross!”
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same way even the chief priests—together with the experts in the law—were mocking him among themselves: “He saved others, but he cannot save himself!
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the Christ, the king of Israel, come down from the cross now, that we may see and believe!” Those who were crucified with him also spoke abusively to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when it was noon, darkness came over the whole land until three in the afternoon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Around three o’clock Jesus cried out with a loud voice, “Eloi, Eloi, lema sabachthani?” which means, “My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?”
speaker: Narrator

text: When some of the bystanders heard it they said, “Listen, he is calling for Elijah!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then someone ran, filled a sponge with sour wine, put it on a stick, and gave it to him to drink, saying, “Leave him alone! Let’s see if Elijah will come to take him down!”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus cried out with a loud voice and breathed his last.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the temple curtain was torn in two, from top to bottom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when the centurion, who stood in front of him, saw how he died, he said, “Truly this man was God’s Son!”
speaker: Narrator

text: There were also women, watching from a distance. Among them were Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James the younger and of Joses, and Salome.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he was in Galilee, they had followed him and given him support. Many other women who had come up with him to Jerusalem were there too.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when evening had already come, since it was the day of preparation (that is, the day before the Sabbath),
speaker: Narrator

text: Joseph of Arimathea, a highly regarded member of the council, who was himself looking forward to the kingdom of God, went boldly to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate was surprised that he was already dead. He called the centurion and asked him if he had been dead for some time.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Pilate was informed by the centurion, he gave the body to Joseph.
speaker: Narrator

text: After Joseph bought a linen cloth and took down the body, he wrapped it in the linen and placed it in a tomb cut out of the rock. Then he rolled a stone across the entrance of the tomb.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses saw where the body was placed.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Sabbath was over, Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James, and Salome bought aromatic spices so that they might go and anoint him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And very early on the first day of the week, at sunrise, they went to the tomb.
speaker: Narrator

text: They had been asking each other, “Who will roll away the stone for us from the entrance to the tomb?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But when they looked up, they saw that the stone, which was very large, had been rolled back.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then as they went into the tomb, they saw a young man dressed in a white robe sitting on the right side; and they were alarmed.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he said to them, “Do not be alarmed. You are looking for Jesus the Nazarene, who was crucified. He has been raised! He is not here. Look, there is the place where they laid him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But go, tell his disciples, even Peter, that he is going ahead of you into Galilee. You will see him there, just as he told you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they went out and ran from the tomb, for terror and bewilderment had seized them. And they said nothing to anyone, because they were afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: Early on the first day of the week, after he arose, he appeared first to Mary Magdalene, from whom he had driven out seven demons.
speaker: Narrator

text: She went out and told those who were with him, while they were mourning and weeping.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they heard that he was alive and had been seen by her, they did not believe.
speaker: Narrator

text: After this he appeared in a different form to two of them while they were on their way to the country.
speaker: Narrator

text: They went back and told the rest, but they did not believe them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he appeared to the eleven themselves, while they were eating, and he rebuked them for their unbelief and hardness of heart, because they did not believe those who had seen him resurrected.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “Go into all the world and preach the gospel to every creature.
speaker: Narrator

text: The one who believes and is baptized will be saved, but the one who does not believe will be condemned.
speaker: Narrator

text: These signs will accompany those who believe: In my name they will drive out demons; they will speak in new languages;
speaker: Narrator

text: they will pick up snakes with their hands, and whatever poison they drink will not harm them; they will place their hands on the sick and they will be well.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After the Lord Jesus had spoken to them, he was taken up into heaven and sat down at the right hand of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: They went out and proclaimed everywhere, while the Lord worked with them and confirmed the word through the accompanying signs.
speaker: Narrator
